text: Aroma of soft juicy peach and mandarin orange. Has a little foam head in the glass and a clear copper body. Flavour is sour lemon and sweet grains. Middled mouthfeel. Just kind meh, I thought, neither here nor there, not memorable.

Pinte en fût dégustée sur place le 23 janvier 2015. Bière blonde dorée limpide. Col épais blanc persistant. Légère odeur de céréales sucrées et de houblon. Très douce, assez sucrée, très amère en finale. Saveur un peu sucrée genre "caramel léger" et un peu citronnée. A assez de corps, bien équilibrée. Amertume franche ressort bien, rafraichissante, se boit bien.

Une note basée sur le style - un style qui mest peu familier. Un look dEurope de lEst aux reflets caramel, translucide et bien vivante. Un nez mielleux de malts généreusement sucrés et amidonés. Une poignée de houblons jeunes et européens. Des saveurs en accord avec les arômes. Une fermentation basse balancée par un corps délicieusement rond et généreux sans jamais être lourd. Leffervescence rend lexpérience légère et agréablement buvable. Des fleurs blanches, du miel et un malt blond; une buvabilité denfer!
Pas vraiment une pils tchèque mais plutôt une vienna lager. Cest pas mal mais très surnoté !

On tap @ LAmere A Boire. Clear golden pour with a white head. A nice bready and floral hop nose. A light skunkiness and some grass. Hints of baked apple. Flavor has a good malty sweetness of bread and biscuit. Slight dough. Grassy hops, mild earth, and some orange peel. A little on the weed heavy side of things, but it works.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear golden with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of various cereals and caramel. Taste is of bread and light spices. It is moderately bitter and a lot more enjoyable than your usual macro pils. Body is light to medium and carbonation a bit sharp (medium-high). Overall a good beer, a bit heavy on the bready notes maybe, but it might be me since I dont tend to drink czech pils that often.

En fût au brouepub lors du Rallye Bières et Plaisirs 2014. Couleur dorée claire, mousse blanche laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de céréales, levure, écorce de citron. Goût de céréales, citron léger, levure, Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.

Pours a medium golden color with a finger of white foam. Nose is a mix of bread malts, light fresh grass and some complex grain. Palate follows the nose and is bright crisp and refreshing with great carbonation and a lovely grainy finish with a slight bitterness that lingers.

Une mousse épaisse pas tout à fait blanche se pose sur une bière dorée et limpide et laisse une vaste dentelle collante. Les céréales et les houblons sallient pour créer un bouquet floral intéressant. Jy ai même détecté des arômes de lavande. Les céréales sont définitivement la grande vedette dans cette interprétation réussie dune Pilsner tchèque. Les houblons Saaz prolongent cette sensation florale sont accotés par un malt caramel bien présent. Pétillante et sèche, cette bière est un incontournable de lendroit.
Had this on draft at the brewpub. Lemon and fruity taste. Average blonde. Had to get it as part of a flight. Or "taster" as they are called in Montreal

On tap at LAmère à Boire, 04/04/2014. Caramel amber pour, thick white head with ample lacing. Aroma is cereal grains, light hay, nice sweetness with grassy hop presence. Taste is caramel, cereal malts, rich, touch of honey, light hop bite in the middle, nice toast character in the finish. Light medium body, round, easy to drink. Quite tasty.
On tap at the brewpub. Clear golden with a frothy white head. fresh grains, bread, honey, herbal hops, biscuity and toasted malts. Medium body, moderate carbonation, creamy texture. Crisp and fresh.
Pint with dany, Yup completely ducking crushing it , tastes like a meal, completely killing it

On tap at brewpub. Pour is hazy golden with white head and lots of lacing. Fresh noble hops and crips malts, low sweetness and dry finish. Low body ad medium carbonation. One of my favorites when I come to Montreal. A classic.

Pinte à lAmère à boire (Montréal). Robe dorée. Arôme de amlt, houblon et fruits. Mlange intéressant et rafraîchissant, mais je dois avouer ne pas être un grand amateur de styles tchèques. Je recommande néanmoins aux amateurs.
Such greatness, brewed since forever. Its crispy, its malty, fresh, just enough hoppy. This is LAmère à Boire.

En fût au broue pub de mtl, robe dorée, arôme fraîche de houblon saaz et de céréale, goût herbacé.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dégustée en fût sur place. de couleur dorée foncée et claire. Nez de grains de céréales fraîches, léger de pain et de houblon floral aux notes herbeuses avec des notes fruitées (agrumes). Rondeur moyenne en bouche et assez pétillante avec une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de grains de malt et de céréales dès lentrée en bouche suivi dun léger goût fruité (agrumes) puis vient ensuite un goût de grains légèrement plus  croustillants avec un léger goût de pain puis en finale lon retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux (gazon et foin) avec des petites florales. Post-goût moyen, légèrement amer de houblon floral et herbeux avec des petites notes très subtiles de créréales fraîches. (printemps 2006)
Arôme fromagée, pain grillé, léger caramel, belle caresse des houblons et fini sec

On tap at lAmère à Boire.
Pours clear golden with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of sweetness, fruits, malt. Taste is of sweetness, malt, some hops. Palate: Ligth body. Overall: Refreshing, somewhat crisp (but less than expected). Well done, somewhat sugary.

On tap at lAmère à Boire. Crystal clear caramel color with a small white head and nice lacing. Aroma of cereals, caramel and hints of citrus. Nose is fresh. Taste is crisp with caramel notes and floral hops hints. Creamy texture. Crisp, clean, refreshing and drinkable. Well done!

Glass at LAmère à Boire, pours a hazy golden orange with a medium white head. Nose is full of crisp grassy hops and some mild bready malts, smells very authentic. Flavour burst of dry grassy hop bite, tasting very authentic to a real Czech pilsner, with lots of depth to the grassy hop bite, with only a slight counterbalance to bready, slightly sweet crisp malts. An awesome thirst-quenching pilsner, perfect for a hot afternoon.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - very slightly hazy blond beer, persistent white foam; subtle flowery hoppiness; medium-bodied, quite dry and gently bitter; long flowery hoppy finish; subtle and very drinkable

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2013 on tap at brewpub. bright lightly golden with a decent white head, some retention and lacing. bready and chewy pils malts - dense, hint of toastiness, fruitiness - grapes, light white wine woodiness, lots of pepper and grass. average carbonation, light to medium body, grassy-herbal-floral-citrusy finish. dry and incredibly balanced. refreshing.  solid pils.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2014 En fût  à Lamère à boire. Couleur jaune or, mousse blanche. Arôme de grains, céréales, houblon. En bouche, douce, parfaite, céréales, houblon. Une bière complexe et simple à la fois. Excellente. Elle donne le goût de voyager..

Un excellent verre sur place.  Un liquide à la robe dorée passablement foncée.  Une tête mousseuse blanche et crémeuse.  Un rideau de dentelles sur la paroi du verre.  Un nez de céréales croquantes et fraiches avec une réponse parfaite de houblons bien parfumés.  Des saveurs qui réjouissent mes papilles.  Des grains, des malts et des fleurs de houblons.  Tout simplement.  Une bouche qui présente une certaine rondeur.  Un pétillement modéré.  Une activité carbonique qui permet un long étalement des flaveurs.  Une texture crémeuse.  Une finale longue et vibrante sur des notes amères florales et épicées.  Veľmi dobré pivo.

18-01-12 Fut: Jaune dorée, limpide et bonne effervescence avec un peu de mousse. Arômes de céréales avec une touche dhoublon et de foin-gason. Saveur bien maltée de céréale avec une fra^cihe note dhoublon. Bien balancée et se boit très facilement. Corps léger avec une texture mnce et croustillante. Bonne carbonisation.
Spicy, grass, cereals, malty and very fresh.It is very clean. Its one of the best «bière de soif» in Montreal. Its the kind of beer I would like to have all year long at home.
From tap at the brewpub. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is roasted malty and breadish. Bitter and dry malty finish. Simple.
On tap at the Brew Pub. Poured a golden color with a smaller sized white head. Grains, some spiciness, grass, and some earth.

On tap at the brewpub.  Poured a crystal clean golden hue with a frothy, dimpled white head.  Nice layered lacing around the glass.  Aroma of grains, breadiness, and a light spicy and resinous hop profile.  Flavor is crisp and clean; grainy and malty notes mirrored by a bittering hop character that follows through into the finish.  Carbonation begins on the prickly side then quickly mellows out to smoothen the palate.  Great example of the style and certainly rivals those which Id sampled in Germany.

On tap at the brewpub. After a Poutin, this was perfect. Pours a clear golden color with a large white head. A very lively palate. A nice biscuit and spicy hop nose. The flavor is clean and crisp; light bitterness, earthy dry malts, spicy Saaz hops, easygoing and very drinkable. Nice.

Draught, 5% at the brewpub. Mild spicy hop aroma. Hazy bright copper colour. The flavour is nicely malty and fruity with a good spicy hoppiness. Clean bitterness. Not as clean as a Czech pils, fruitier, but OK.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2010 On tap. I get dominant floral hops in the aroma, also crisp cereal, bread and citrus.The flavor is a nice balance between bitter oranges and honey sweetness, hops and malts. There is a little bit of pepper too. Nice full bodied palate for a pilsner. As good as it gets for a pils; refreshing and complex. That pint went down so fast. 

Re-rate: The bitterness is slightly overdone - even for the style. Aroma is faint you really need to go digging to pick something up. Very enjoyable nonetheless.

On tap at Amère à Boire, Pours clear pale amber with a small head. Great lacing. Nose is grain, bready and hoppy. Taste is very malty with a nice bitterness all along the profile. Finish is very malty with a fine bitterness. Malt is very present. There is also a hint of fruits in it. Maybe passion fruit or pinneaple or something. This beer is a perfect pilsner (Im no pilsner expert though). Perfect for hot summer. Utterly refreshing and drinkable yet very satisfying in taste. I dream of buying a keg of this and pour myself a glass each day after work !

Light golden beer.  Thin head.  Aroma is light and spicy.  Citrus and zesty hops with a similar character as in the helles, but the hops here play a more prominent role.  Soft lingering betterness.  Another awesome lager.

On tap at lAmère à boire Clear golden with a medium frothy white head with good retention and lacing. Aroma is an awesome mix of malt and noble hops with a tiny note of caramel. Flavor is crisp malt and noble hops. Medium body. Ive never been to Czech Republic or Germany so Ive never had a fresh european pilsener, but this one is the best Pilsener Ive had. Very refreshing, yet well malted and hopped.

On tap at the brewpub. 
A great example of a good pils. Crisp, with a great balance of hops, and that amazing bready grainy, maltiness that i love in a good lager. This brewpub is a lagerheads wet dream.

On tap at LAmere a Boire.  Pours a clear orange amber with a medium white head.  Light crisp citrus notes, with a bit of yeast, and grain and malt.  Thin to medium bodied, but on the creamy side due to the carbonation.  Finishes with a bit of a metallic bitterness and grain.
Sample, maybe a big one. Amber. Minimal head but still a delicate lacing. Nicely hopped with an unusual appricot edge to the flavour.
une bonne pinte sur place, bière blonde dorée avec une belle mousse épaisse et durable, nez frais de houblon, bouche fraîche, crisp, rafraichissante, bonne amertume en fin de bouche

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2010 Verre à la brasserie. Arômes de houblon herbacé, épicé et floral. On reconnaît également des notes de grains. Robe dorée et très légèrement trouble, peu de mousse et belle effervescence. Moyennement ronde en bouche, le malt très légèrement sucré et développant de magnifiques notes de céréales fraîches, laisse la place à un houblon épicé et floral bien présent. Finale moyennement amère. Très bien équilibré.

One of two great czech style lagers I had while in Montreal - really strong noble hop presence throughout, with a particularly sharp bite at the end - just enough malt to let the crisp hops shine through without drying out the beer - super refreshing and crisp.
1/16/08 notes:  on tap at brewpub, this beer has classic pilsner hops/grassiness, but has a nice faint floral touch. Nice light, session beer, with a medium body and dry finish.  Well done.

Draught at LAmère à Boire. Pours a slightly hazy dark orange with an average size diminishing white head. Decent lacing. Wow, the aroma is great! Fruity with Saaz hops and malt, it kind of reminds me of Brooklyn lager which I love. Flavours also fruity along with grain, hops and sweet malt -- all well balanced and quite refreshing. Medium bodied. A damn fine version of the style, Im impressed.

On tap at the brewpub.  Dark brown, small white head, looks murky and interesting.  Mild saaz hop aroma with some biscuit.  Great taste - strong saaz hops, refreshing malt, medium to full bodied.  What a fantastic pils, I love it when this style is done right.

Draught at the brewpub. Nice golden-amber with a small white head that leaves lots of lace. Aroma is very nice, with fresh malt and sharp Saaz hops. Crisp body. Flavour is perfectly balanced between the sweet malts and herbal hops. A really solid pilsner - excellent!
On tap at LAmere à Boire. The color is golden with a white head. The taste is malty and sweet of fruits. There is a bit of bitterness at the end.

On Tap @ Brewpub with Glougoburp.  Pours gold/red with a half finger off white head.  Light wheaty fresh nose.  The taste is sublime for the style, bright fresh, grassy, pretty damn spot on and well done!

[506-20070811] Tap @ LAmère à Boire (Montréal, QC). Strong wheat and bready yeast aroma. Clear, yellow body with a quick foamy white head. More wheat and bready yeast in the flavour with a sweet finish. Medium body. Great starter for a pub crawl, has a nice finish.

Small white head. Yellow body. Faint, malty grainy hop aroma. Dry grainy hoppy resiny taste, clean and sharp. Very refreshing and balanced. Sweetish. Dry sweetish grass and honey aftertaste. Lovely session beer. (0.133l draft.)

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2007 5 oz. sampler at the brewpub.  App.: light-med. golden and clear.  Aroma: sourdough, slightly grainy, cereal, light grassy hops, faintly citrusy.  Palate: thin body and med. carbonation.  Flav.: careal and grain, faint piney hops.  A bit more grassy hops to finish, slight bitterness and everso slight fruitiness. OK, but nothing special.
Update: SE13/07: This seems better than the last time I had it.  Better hops and nicer bitterness  more true to style.  A bit of light homebrew mash flavour, but tasty.  New rating: 3.3.

Draught at Lamère à boire; eye: amber with yellowish reflections, nice compact white head, nice effervescence, very slightly hazy, lacing; nose: hops (grain), malt, caramel, freshness, vinegar (?); mouth : malt, hint of acridity, caramel, hops, finale in malt with a hint of caramel that covers it, becomes a bit more peppery (alcohol becomes more present) as it warms up, creamy texture, full body, medium carbonation, mildly bitter and sweet

FRANÇAIS

Fût, bue à Lamère à boire; oeil : ambrée avec des reflets jaunâtres, belle mousse blanche compacte, belle effervescence, très légèrement voilée, dentelle; nez : houblon (grain), malt, caramel, fraîcheur, vinaigre (?); bouche : malt, petite pointe âcre, caramel, houblon, finale en malt avec un petite pointe de caramel qui couvre le tout, devient un peu plus « poivrée » (alcool plus présent) lorsquelle gagne en température, texture crémeuse, corsé, moyennement carbonatée, moyennement amère et sucrée

Draught.  At LAmère à Boire.  Pale clear gold with a small white head.  Light malty aroma with well-defined perfumy/floral hop character, perhaps a touch mild.  Taste - zing! - solid bitter floral/perfume hop bitterness, dry and crisp malt framework, nicely balanced - I mean really nice, this is good stuff.  Has an average pils body, just the right amount of astringency and carbonation, a mild and quick finish - I only wish Id had this sitting on the patio on a hot day - this is a solid pils, recommended.

The body was medium orange with a white head. The aroma was sweet pears with some grass. The taste was funky with some bread. There was also light celery and some carrots. A nice dry finish. A good pils.
Couleur jaune foncé, presquorange, petit collet. Arome dhoublon très présant. Goût dhoublon sucré et rafréchissant. Très bon!
A great example. Hoppy, malty, touch of sulphur, with just the right amount of butterscotch. Yummy and refreshing -- a session beer.
Robe blonde très claire surmontée dune mousse blanche en dentelle épaisse persistente. Arômes de malt et de houblon. Saveurs de citron, de caramel et de céréales.
hop flavour very evident.  quite floral.   pleasant flavour, appropriate for the style.

good head lots of lace.Floral aroma. Saaz hops and Czech yeast. Crisp, clean taste with dry and fruity finish. Well malted and well carbonated. Not the subtle complexity of the real Czechs I have had.

A hazy orange beer with a small white head. The aroma is very lightly malty, while the flavor contains lots of hops and is very crisp on a malty backgroun. The flavor is really Bohemian, but the flavor lacks a lot.

Verre de dégustation à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeurs de céréales, de fleurs et de caramel (?). Apparence: La couleur est blonde et on y dénote aucune bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de miel et de caramel. La durée de larrière goût est moyenne. Palette: Le corps et la texture sont mince. Leffervescence en bouche est moyenne. Présence fruité en arrière goût. (Rating #330)

Perfect. Pours a very pale yellow, thin head and a little cloud. Mouthfeel is a little sandy {my head hurts, drank to much on the brewpub crawl last night} and overall clean and crisp. Taste is lovley, creamy sweet malt completly balanced with bitter hops. Herbal undertones, a little citrus zest, and a spicy "Mulled" flavour. Aftertaste is a caramel, bitter and saaz. I like it. Cheers.
Draught at the brewpubClear yellow, lots of white head and lacing. Nose of saaz and creamy malts. The flavor is balanced, light bitterness for a pilsner, very nice and sessionist.

RBSG 05.  I was really hungover that day in montreal, but this beer definitley helped me to start the day.  Very well made and refreshing.  Pours a deep gold/light copper- a bit darker than some czech pils’s, with a nice sticky pure white head.  Aroma is very herbal floral and a bit spicy from the hops, yet there is a nice bready pils malt backbone.  Bready malt flavor with a fair amount of floral hops and a good crisp clean finish.  This reminded me a lot of the czech pils’ in prague.  Made to style.
07.09.05  Tap at brewpub.  Dark straw with a thin white head, sheets.  Aromas lightly barnyard.  Hop/spice/green bell pepper bite on top of solid earthiness.  Complex and stylish solid brew.

The most surprising beer from my visit.  Large tall foamy head with a copper and light orange colored body.  Has a soapy, buttery nose which reminds me of some "open fermented" German pils and wheats: dusty bread crumbs and toasted grains, yeast abounding everywhere... leaving a sour corn and musky but fresh taste of cereals, oatmeal, granola, that sort of thing.  Very fresh tasting, and a great example of a session pils.  Very flavorful.
Pour is dark clear golden with bright white head...smell was citrus and floral with some cookie dough as well...taste was sweet with a hoppy butterscotch finish...

2005 RBSG Montreal Saturday. Pale golden colour with a creamy and frothy off-white head. Lightly fruity, caramel, and toasty aroma. Caramel, honey, toasty malt flavours with a fruity and nutty bitter finish. Medium bodied, juicy, refreshing.

Amber-orangeish color, thick foamy white head, with good lacing, fruity, leafy, citrus note, flower hop aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate, with hop flowers, leafy, herbal, hoppy, earthy, leading to a good hop bittering finish.
Golden/Orange color with a small white head. Great fruity taste with hint of caramel (of maple syrup) are really mising great. Simple and refreshing, really enjoyable.

Golden and opaque, with a frothy, clingy head.  Its a lager, what else would you expect?  Aroma is like a flour mill on a grassy meadow, a bag of grain spinkled with noble hops.  Much more malt than your average lager, the carbonation was just smooth enough to hit it off for me, especially considering the fact that it was scorching hot outside.  Like a beefed up Pilsener Urquell.  Even ale zealots will appreciate this one.
A really distinctive pilsner type flavour. Two things - munch malt and saaz hops! Well balanced. Clean tasting. Lots of flavour, but perhaps not as sharp as some pilsners.

draught. light golden body with a small white head. solid pilsener aroma consists of cookie dough and lots of saaz - its pretty much exactly what youd want out of this style. crisp body with moderate hopping along with sweet soft malts. very flavourful and refreshing. Id like some of this on hand in Toronto.

ark golden lager with a thin white head. Malty aroma with notes of strawberries and light crisp hops. Crisp malt with wonderful fruity hops with notes of oranges. Nutty notes comes out nicely. Medium and balanced bodied.

Almost clear, orange-tan with a frothy, white head that lasts 2-3 minutes and produces nice lacing.  Strangely, the aroma seemed a bit sour, but with a clean maltiness and a small amount of Saaz hops.  Blast of malty lager flavour accentuated by a curious sourness.  Crisp with subtle noble hops and a little bit of graininess.  Light to medium body, moderate carbonation and a bit of a dry feeling at the end.

TAP: Cheesy lager nose with a slight spice kick, hazy gold color, low head. Nice unfiltered body - lets the character of this beer come through. Honey-ish malt with a decent broad, but light hop bitter end. Some butter tastes in the middle, unfortunately. More on the thin and refreshing side of things.

on tap at the brewpub, pours a light amber, crystal clear and sparkling.  head was thin and creamy.  aroma was hoppy, with hints of yeast and spices.  flavor was just as hoppy if not more, tones of caramel and some spice tones.  the bitterness at the end was prominent, but not to the point that i was put off by it.  very crisp mouthfeel, with a pleasant amount of body for a pilsner.

On draught at the brewpub, 3/5/05 with Muzzlehatch and tiggmtl.  Poured out of a pitcher.  A sparkling golden-yellow with light burnished copper tinges, quite lovely looking with plenty of white head and tons of lace.  Smells of herbal, spicy hops and plenty of dough.  Good yeast character, very perfumy, strong, peppery nose.  Flavor opens up with strong hops notes.  They certainly got every last ounce of bitterness out of those hops!  Crisp to the extreme, very spicy and with a strong, honey and doughy malt to follow.  Damn, this is very forceful with the hops bitterness, with tons of bite from the yeast.  Awesome body on this one, didnt find the thinning some have talked about.  I actually thought this was too hoppy, but that was really my only complaint.  Love the spicy, fiery, warming flavors.  Id go back for more of this in a second.  Went very well with rabbit and spaetzle.

Draft... Clear, golden lager with a rocky head.  The nose is of citrus fruit and very bready. The flavor matches the nose. Light-bodied and creamy with fizzy carbonation. Crisp, lightly bitter  finish.

Small creamy and frothy white head, fair lacing, mostly diminushing.  Golden body of average thick density.  Moderate to heavy malt aroma.  Caramel, light to moderate hops and little trace of honey on the nose.  Average to heavy sweetness in flavor.  Moderate sweetness in finish.  Sweet over the hop bitterness (could be balanced a bit more toward the hop bitterness).  Average to long persistance of flavors in my mouth.  Medium body, a bit oily and syrupy.  Soft carbonation.  Tasted on tap at the brewpub in a small tasting glass, 2nd of 10 beer in this session (18 november 2004).

Sweet clean malts, touch of hops. Clear, gold, white head. Medium bodied , malty with light bitter finish . This lager is lacking crispness and smoothes that true quality Czech Pils got.  Could be past its prime?
Sweet inviting malt nose, golden, little head. Mld malt flavour, a hint of hops, light bodied, creamy, softly sweet. Decent.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2007 The pour reveals a clear golden color with a medium, creamy, white head. Superb aroma of hay, noble hops and malt. The flavor is near perfect, theres floral, fruity, noble hops with hay and crisp, robust malt, it finishes with bitterness. The body has a full thickness with a creamy texture and gentle carbonation. This is a superb pilsener.
Light amber, nice large head. Hoppy pilsner nose with some malt. Grainy flavours, with nice hop kick. Nothing too exciting, but works well. Draught.
gold, white head.  bready, biscuity malt aroma with grassy hop and a  little fruit(aple?).  grainy, cereal malt flavour and the hops seem to dance around the tongue.  nicely done.
Orangey-amber colour.  Rocky head.  Earthy-fruity hops in the nose w/ slight biscuity malt.  Creamy, with light hops and depth of bready malts.
Shy head but nice golden color. Good character for a pilsener, good hops, almost fruity. Very well balanced between refreshness and aftertaste.

Golden and limpid body topped with a nice and thick but quick-fading white head. Fresh hops and bread aroma. The flavor is lightly fruity and dominated by Saaz hops. Good bitter final. This is a nice Pilsner.
Gold in colour.  Aroma was or light hops, some sweetness and grass.  Flavour was hoppy, slight caramel, light body.  Finished with a dry bitterness.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2007 Solid appearance for a pilsner, golden with a big white head, very foamy and nicely sticky. Aroma of baked cookies, pancakes and light fresh Saaz hops. This is pretty good, good malty character well-balanced by the meticulous hopping which bring a nice herbal saaz cripsness, the finish is a little watery, the bottom of the keg perhaps.. The body is top notch though, filling and velvety. / A few weeks later, I find it far less crisp with a more restrained Saaz character, surprisingly not so consistent? From 3.7 to 3.4/ Seems to vary between 3.1 and 4.1 between my visits. Ill round this up to 3.6, but know that you can face something spectacular when ordering this.

Pale strawy colour, not much in the way of head. Had sort of a funky floral hoppy odour that was not altogether pleasing. Slight caramel notes. Didn't really taste off per se but I really didn't care for it.
(Draught) Thin, white head and an amber body. Grapefruit nose. Flavour of grapefruits and a hop finish. Good.
Clear straw with white head. Aroma is mild sweet and grassy.  Taste is sweet grassy, with light herbal finish.  Light body.
Clear golden in color, small white head.Florally hop aroma,with sublte malt charcater,finishes very clean.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2004 Re-rate: Sazz hop nose and biscuity malt aroma. Clear golden coloured with nice white head that recedes to a good cover and thick ring. Hops nicely balance malty flavour with a nice crispness and a restrained but lasting bitterness. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy. Subdues carbonation allows appreciation of the subtleties of this offering at length. On tap at the brewpub. Original rating 6-4-9-4-18=4.1: Somewhat slight hop aroma. Beautiful clear golden caramel colour. Excellent carbonation with a nice clean white head. Very grainy and biscuity flavour with wonderful full-body. Saaz bitterness shines through in the finish. On tap at the brewpub.
Bright, clear gold. White head. Floral, grassy aroma. Soft, lightly grainy feel. Lovely biscuity, pale malts up front. Crisp hops in the finish. Refreshing Pils.
Decent saazy aroma.  Malts are juicy and feel real nice on the tongue.  Tandem sweet/dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2005 April 2003 Fruity (apricots) creamy, honey, nice body, tasty but ultimately rather bland.  If it werent for the smoke, I would probably have gotten more out of these...4/3/7/3/11 2.8

March 2005:  very clean, smooth, malty, nice sweet-hoppy balance, lovely subtle bitterness in the finish, very full..clear gold with excellent head retention...much better with little smoke in the establishment.

This is the best Czeck Pilsner Ive yet had that is brewed in North America.  It has a huge Saaz profile, but pretty much all bittering character, perhaps a little in the flavour but none in the aroma.  A totally quenching beer.
Golden color.  This beer smells and tastes like honeyish grapefruit with a white wine touch.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2012 Note: Since theyve switched to whole leaf Saaz (they used pellets before), this beer has gone from very good to world-class. A simply gorgeous BohPils.
The Lure:Lovely biscuity pils malt and yeast interplay serving as fluffy cushions for the hovering oily, earthy Saaz hoppiness. Mild citrus fruit swimming within. This is a spot-on quality re-creation of the Czech pils which many Czech breweries would be proud of. The only thing which could be improved upon for a perfect emulation would be a loftier head of foam, as this one possesses a very shy, although lingering, ring.

The Festivities:Again, the pils malt cookies and Czech yeast hug so amorously, they are difficult to distinguish separately. Oily, earthy hops are prolonged into a sublime grassy, herbal bitterness, aided into balance by the aforementioned yeast/malt love affair. Citrus fruit are definitely admitted into this humble palace, and converse amicably with all participants. I can practically smell the cheese-filled meat and its paprika sauce, and see the accompanying knedlikys and potato pancakes, this is how real this bohemian pilsner is.

Transcendence:Red roofs, cobblestone streets, intermingling gothic and renaissance architectures, church spires on the expansive town square...peace within me.
Golden coloured. Light bodied, dry bitter. Some saaz hop aroma.
